name: Face Plant
description: Uses 1 Core + the Genesis cycle. This is a slower deck that wants to get out Magnum Opus ASAP (with Test Run) and then get one of each kind of icebreaker with Special Orders to break through everything. Mr Li will let you scroll past redundant copies of cards while looking for key pieces, and All-Nighter gives you enough ticks to play multiple Notoriety in a single turn for a surprise finish.

name: Release the Kraken
description: Uses 1 Core + the Genesis cycle. This is an aggressive deck that uses Snitch to expose ice and then derezzes and destroys it with Emergency Shutdown, Forged Activation Orders and Kraken. Sneakdoor and Special Order will help you keep making runs against HQ to advance your Nerve Agent and get money even after defences come down, while The Maker's Eye can be effective against an unprotected R&D.

name: Money Wall
description: Uses 1 Core + the Genesis cycle. Uses ice of all three kinds to make the runner's job difficult, and also using several cards that make them spend more credits to slow them down. Then you can use your own credits to score your agendas, perhaps ticking up Project Beale further than the minimum for more points.

name: 2014 Rainy Day Games 4th Place Paintbrush Kit Deck
description: Published to be shared. A deck I made the night before the tournament based off prior Kit experience and a few double time OCTGN games. 4-1 against weyland:babw, nbn:twiy, weyland:grndl, weyland:babw, nbn:twiy. Things I would immediately change: ditch the gordian and the cyber solutions for either money or clone chips. The deck is super fast and can easily be getting 2 rnd accesses every turn for free before nbn can score out an astro. I thought the weakest matchup would be weyland but breaking hive for free and corroder for barriers bigger than yogosaur made it a non issue. For non paintbrush Kit cyber cypher is generally better than yogosaurus but with paintbrush you walk into servers three ice deep for just two clicks running yogosaur. Definitely super fun and super viable.

name: Jinteki Credit Lock
description: RSVP/Tollbooth + Caprice/Herrings/NAPD/Fetal AI Chum+Tollbooth Net Damage on central servers to drain more resources before they hit your remotes. Mix of random 1-of ICE to keep things unpredictable.

name: HB: NEXT Design - Thronerunner
description:
This is the current version of the deck built live on the Throne Runner OCTGN Stream.

Focuses on a strong economy and forcing the runner to waste clicks and resources on trashing assets.

If you are able to start the 3 with at least 1 Cadeuceus, 1 other cheap ice and either Heimdall then it is most effective to ice HQ with Cad and R&D with another cheap option. Use Heimdall to start a beefy remote.

Drop economic assets before the runner has the means to trash them and use Bioroid Efficiency Research to rez the big ICE in the remote. Scoring Mandatory Upgrades is not crucial to victory with this deck.

Jackson is meant as a fail-safe on a failed Accelerated Beta Test. I score them out of hand only using Biotic Labour after scoring a Priority Req.

Do not be afraid to let the runner access R&D as there are only 9 agendas in the deck.

Cheers!

Nightly streams of Netrunner and Game of Thrones LCG
www.twitch.tv/thronerunner
www.youtube.com/thronerunner

name: Whizzard: Rise n' Shine - Thronerunner
description:
This is the current version of the deck built live on the Throne Runner OCTGN Stream.

This deck's main focus is on having a strong economy in order to get Morning Star out as early as possible via Retrieval Run. However, if the Corp is able to block R&D early, Knight is still available to provide early pressure.

By making use of Desperado you are able to trash assets for a credit less and have enough memory to run Morning Star, Mimic, Yog, and either Keyhole or Hemorrhage hosted on Djinn with Datasuckers to suit any situation.

Dyson Fractal Generators are included to protect against Power Shutdown but also serve to make Morning Star all the more godlike.

The surplus in credits and deceptive tempo will allow for Vamp on an unsuspecting and porous HQ.

Cheers!

Nightly streams of Netrunner and Game of Thrones LCG www.twitch.tv/thronerunner www.youtube.com/thronerunner

name: Thorns
description: A miserable pile of roses.

name: Hiding in the Weeds
description: Uses 1 core + the Genesis cycle. Increase your hand size so you can hide your cumbersome agendas behind a wall of ice, use precognition to make r&d safer, and make another ice wall on a remote server where you can safely advance agendas. Your assets don't need much protection because of the high trash cost and they are designed to give you more money in the long run. Power grid overload is for destroying e3 feedback implants so your bioroids can't be easily bypassed.

name: Net Deck
description: Uses 1 Core + the Genesis cycle. This deck has lots of ways to deal net damage to the runner, like using Chum followed by an ice that's hard to break, or the runner randomly hitting snares in deck and hand. Then you can finish them off by using Neural EMP and scoring your agendas.

name: Tank Wars
description: Uses 1 Core + the Genesis cycle. The plan is to search your deck for two cards among the scorched earths and archived memories to deal 8 damage to the runner at once. There are several ways to search for cards and to tag the runner on your own turn. This deck is light on ice so it focuses on ones that are hardest to break - Oversight AI can res Hadrian's Wall or Archer, but there are enough 1 point agendas that you can res Archer the normal way if you prefer.

name: Andro Siphon - Beijing Store Champ 2nd
description:
Well, As you see, an extremely common seen Andromeda.

Good at Siphon & Criminal Tricks & Stuff.

Got 2nd place Locally in Beijing this month (:з」∠)

PS: got a Wotan Play-mat with this (:з」∠)

name: Weyland SEPC - Beijing Store Champ 2nd
description:
A usual Weland Burn Deck.

Played 3 rounds and got 3 kills last Sunday. Lost one match on Runner. So only got Second Place.

First Kill: MR+SE+SE Second Kill: MR Runner for 4 tags, Runner cleared Tags, then run. Got SEA+SE+SEed. Third Kill: MR Runner, Runner ran and Hit an 1 pointer. Got PC+PC+SE. (This was just so fun =w=)

Happy games. (:з」∠)

name: GRNDL Cover Up Conspiracy 1.1
description:
Bad publicity?! What bad publicity? What are you talking about? smile

Second edition: listening to the comments given by pyroplop i decided to make some changes, less bad publicity removal and more meat damage, in perfect Weyland style.

name: I'm a BIG GIRl now! 2.0
description:
Where we are now

This deck started of as a monster-rig Chaos Theory at the release of garrote. With alot of playtesting and change of playstyle, the monster ice breakers stayed, but where I once had alot of tutoring, I know focus more on account denial.

Getting richer than Bill Gates

Magnum Opus and Katie Jones is more than enough to get your economy insanely out of hand. That with the Account Siphons of course. Vamp is the cremé de la cremé of the account denial, and will keep the corp poor.

You can't keep me out forever

But the core of this deck is to make huge r&d runs. With early account denial, tje corp will feel the need to ice up HQ, while leaving r&d more fragile. That's when you RDI + maker's eye for a solid dig, then harass hq and remotes for a couple of turns.

I went and broke your fortress

With Garrote, Torch, and Battering Ram, getting in will be a piece of cake. Remember, you want to make big, multi-access, runs. So 6cr MOpus and 3cr on kati is totally viable, and will leave you with 9cr and 3 clicks next turn (if katie wasnt stacked from before).

Don't get a heart attack

This deck plays extremely aggressive early game, run early, and run alot. The test run/scavenge combo will help you get a full breaker suite out faster, and really cheap. Then build up your multi-access machine for the win. Just don't be too reckless, or you might end up flat lined.

Have fun!

name: hostage andy
description: just another deck

name: Iain Galloway Corp Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 1st place Runner Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 2nd place Corp Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 2nd place Runner Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 3rd place Corp Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 3rd place Runner Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 4th place Corp Deck
Black Lion Games Store Championship 4th place Runner Deck
The Impressionist v4
description: Cheat out Torch or Yog.0 as early as possible, Scavenge Yog to Yog0saurus. Datasucker for troublesome high strength ice. Paintbrush + Yog0saurus makes it easy and free to break a vast majority of rezzed ice. Inti is in to counter Wraparound and to provide a cheap way to break an inner Ice Wall. Forged Activation Orders for worrisome inner unrezzed ice, Sharpshooter to prevent your rig from blowing up upon facechecking that inner Grim, Archer or Rototurret. Tinkering as added insurance and a bit of surprise.

name: Black Lion Games Store Championship 1st place Corp Deck 1.1
Noise - Blackmail lock
description:
The combo:

  1. Play activist support + New Angeles city hall

  2. avoid tag from activist support with NACH, give corp bad pub

  3. Use blackmail + infiltration to lockdown remote play, or to slam R&D with Mediums, recurred by 3 Deja, 2 SoT, and 1 Levy

  4. Aesop to kill activist (and wyldside, if needed)

All that said - combos are bad if you dont have other lines of play. Other things this deck serves to establish:

  1. Running early is always good, but if you force the corp to rez ice, you wont be able to get through with blackmail alone. Thats where Knight comes in, for high str ice, and parasite, for low str. Use these to keep pressure on the corp while Wyldsiding through your deck and building your combo. Generally ice that is rezzed early is pretty vulnerable to parasite, and blackmail locking a remote gives you time to let your parasites to tick down, rather than relying on sucker counters to go for an instant kill. Each rezzed ice that dies to parasite or the corp sacs to kill a knight is a win for you. Compound the issue by using Imp to trash ice from centrals.

  2. rush decks can stymie this by simply scoring agendas before you get your combo together. Chakana should force them to virus clear while you build your rig, and imp gets rid of pesky stuff like biotic and sansan.

  3. Imp and parasite are important, and are good targets for recursion in the right gamestate. Imp and parasite have a '2 for 1' effect in noise, both killing at least one card, and milling another. This deck aims to make best use of that ability. I dont like relying on a single combo to win, so the combination of knight, parasite, and imp should allow for alternate methods of pressure, especially on centrals, where blackmail is best at keeping remotes unsafe.

name: Parabolic anabolic
Chaos Theory 1.8.2
description: This is a heavily revised version of CT I've been trying to make work. I am using SMC to get the small breakers out quickly then Scavenging them to bring out the bigger breakers later. Diesel and QT help cycle the deck. Kati and Magnum for econ. Dino helps support the MU cost and makes Morning Star hit harder. I like Maker's Eye and R&D Interface as a way of hitting hard.

name: Building A Better Boom
description:
Weyland is an archetype defined by SEA Source + Scorched Earth, or in more general terms meat damage kills. This is a fact that both Runners and Weyland players struggle with during deck-building and play. The existence of Scorched Earth as a card single-handedly forces two to three Plascrete Carapaces to enter almost every competitive Runner deck. Expectations are important, and the BABW card on the table comes with a whole slew of them.

You've probably looked at the decklist already if you've read this far and obviously I'm playing only a single Scorched Earth. Don't be fooled, or do if you're a runner. It's a display model in 95% of games. I think whether or not to focus on Scorched Earth is a core choice for any Weyland deck. We've seen 'vegan' Weyland decks that play no meat damage at all, but I think that's really giving up a strength of the faction, especially with some of the new toys Weyland's been given.

The nice thing about giving up on Scorched Earth in particular however, is everyone else still has to operate under the assumption you are. Shadow traces are fought, Account Siphon or Snare tags are cleared, etc. Everyone respects Scorched, moreso with the Power Shutdown + Accelerated Diagnostics combo being able to bust even a triple Plascrete protection. This deck does its best to exploit those fears to score points. I believe the best Weyland decks present the threat of death while advancing agendas calmly in the Runner's face. "Take this, I dare you," your challenge implicit as your gazes lock across the table.

I decided to use Punitive Counterstrike instead of Scorched in this deck to save influence on SEA Sources and still present a credible meat damage threat. Power Shutdown can be used to extend a scoring window by cracking a Plascrete or safeguarding barriers by destroying Corroder. Shadows create an economic edge by forcing a break or draining the Runner's credits fighting the trace before they realize what they're up against.

Running almost all three point agendas makes Punitive Counterstrike much more threatening, as two threaten a kill with no reference to tags. Taking Plascretes off the board will make running a dicey proposition at best and this deck attempts to leverage the best of Weyland's economy agendas and operations to create money disparity, both to rez expensive ICE and potentially land a Punitive kill.

Finally, we come to ICE. ICE choice is mostly personal preference in my mind. Show someone a deck and give them a number of slots and influence to work with and you'll see a ton of different choices. This is already long enough without getting into the specifics of my ICE choice, but the generalization is that given this deck's economy I usually picked the more expensive, but more taxing for the runner, option for my slots.

name: Paintbrush theory
Yogbrush
Run Hard
description: Use your run events for full benefit and ignore those remotes. Just make superefficient runs on the centrals

name: Building Better Diagnostics (v1.1)
description:
This is my adaptation of Voltigasm's SC-winning Dual-Combo GRNDL, seen here:

http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/3599/dual-combo-grndl

I wanted to add Reclamation Order, Biotic Labor, and Posted Bounty. This forced a switch from GRNDL to BABW.

I'll be testing this alongside an Accelerated PsychoBeale list I'm brewing. For science!

name: Untrashable Reversion (DT)
Halcyon
description: A study to revive a strong late game process.

name: HQ Fuel
description:
So, having played with knights now for a long time in Gabe, and doing quite well with them, I've decided to try to shove my main Gabe Knight build into a box with my gabe vampire build and spray the whole thing down with pheromones and see what happens.

This deck pressures R&D some with interface, archives with Sneakdoor, and HQ with siphon, vamp, and other normal criminal tricks. Progressive runs get better with pheromones, which can be used to trash things in HQ, pay off the tags you get from siphon mid run using NACH, as well as pay into a massive vamp if the corp won't clear pheromones. Basically draw big and play criminal as normal, while trying to build a little bit more rig than normal to up your efficiency. With only a few pheromones counters you can use gabe's ability with desperado to score an easy mark with HQ runs, even through ice!

E3 protects knight, and makes peacock and knight more efficient, and poops in Janus's salad. Might be a cut, but I'm liking it more and more each time I deploy it. Akamatsu protects both, and gets the MU you need to roll out the pheromones and SdB

Thoughts on the first version?

name: Yogbrush 2.0
Rielle Hoarder
description:
This is my take on the Stimhack Kit deck.

This deck relies heavily on finding an early Personal Workshop on which the majority of her Rig will be hosted as you build your economy.

Public sympathy allows for an increased hand size to lessen the likelihood of being flatlined.

The increased hand-size also means that you can make Stimhack runs and use the 9 credits to install whatever you need on the fly making this a very high tempo deck.

Nightly streams of Netrunner and Game of Thrones LCG
www.twitch.tv/thronerunner
www.youtube.com/thronerunner

name: Dino Ninja Attack
Chaos Theory Bomb
description: My first try at a Chaos Theory deck.

name: Cryptic
Cryptic
They Live!
description: My hand at wanting a fun ChiLo deck.

name: HB-raffe
description: I got this list from Kyle Day--it is very, very solid.

name: Weyland
description:
Generic Weyland

Corporate Troubleshooter with Archer or Roto for standard ice destruction.

Extra advancement token for Project Atlas to take Hostile Takeover to score it in one turn. Extra token can also be used for Scorched Earth's, or a SEA Source depending which piece of the combo you need.

The victory conditions feel balanced, and I find about half my wins being from VP, the other half from Meat Damage.

name: Noise
description:
Generic Noise

Does a very large amount of milling, with 1x of the Anarch breaker suite with Crypsis.

The idea is to mill significantly, all the while threatening all 3 centrals. The 1x Demolition Run comes into play usually when the corp starts developing a remote. The economy tightens up, and there is usually a weakness in ice that develops in R&D or HQ. Combined with multi access, demolition run eliminates multiple cards. Best used mid-game when the corp has cards they require as part of a combo or things they might just deem valuable (Scorched Earths, a 2nd copy of Jackson Howard, Accelerated Diagonistics, Shipment from Sansan, etc)

The economy feels sufficient, although I never very feel rich with this deck. Cheap installations come from the Sahasraras. These virus' will mill a card. Aesop can then (not necessarily immediately) convert the viruses into credits.

The 1x Same Old Thing doubles as a second Demolition Run or Levy.

Most games have been won via Milling, but I don't feel that's necessarily representative of the versatility of the deck. The natural reaction to aggressive milling has been to thoroughly ice up archives. When the point is reached where its not feasible for me to go after the archives, I often just continue milling, which has caught corps off guard.

name: Haas-Bioroid
description:
Generic Haas-Bioroid

Strong Drip economy, with powerful ice.

Caprice Nisei works in conjunction with click-taxing ice, making runs very expensive.

Corporate troubleshooter works well with Roto and Viktor 1.0, pushing the latter out of Yog range.

Accelerated Beta Test and Priority Requisitions for free rezzing of big ice.

The deck is fairly generically strong, in the usual HB big ice way. I don't like having corp decks that has only one path to victory, but ETF's economy is just too strong.

name: Lone Army v0.1
Haas-Bioroid SE Variant
description:
Generic Haas-Bioroid with Scorched Earth modification

Strong Drip economy, with powerful ice. Like normal HB decks, has ABT and Priority Req to free install big ice like Heimdall 2.0, Tollbooth, and Viktor 2.0 .

The main difference between this and it's predecessor is the addition of the singular Scorched Earth. Draco, the Ichi's, and the Snare can generate tags. If the Runner's tagged, Scorched Earth into Archived Memories into a second Scorched Earth can be played. Runners often have a disregard for tags against HB, and this punishes that.

The deck is fairly generically strong, in the usual HB big ice way. The sacrifice of Caprice is unfortunate, but I do like the additional path to victory. Scorched Earth often catches people off guard. However, if the trap is discovered, and/or plascretes are played, the Corp can just easily disregard the single Scorched Earth and continue to play this like a Big Ice HB deck. The archived memories that would have contributed to the Scorched Earth can just as easily be used to bring back a Campaign, Corporate Troubleshooter, or the single Snare.

name: Chaos Theory + Atman
description:
An Atman build using CT. Comments welcome, but bear in mind I only have one copy of the Core cards. Thanks.

(Core, WLA, ASIS, CE, TA, FP, C&C)

name: NBN - Caprice
description:
Generic NBN

A generic NBN deck, with additions from Double Time.

Caprice synergizes with NBN very well, although she is very expensive influence-wise. RSVP provides fantastic protection for NAPD Contract, Red Herrings, and Caprice. RSVP in front of a Pop-up window shuts down servers. Eli is surprisingly taxing, and also synergizes with Caprice.

The singular Red Herring throws off calculations. It'll often feign as a San San.

Draco's have the multi-pronged purpose of being a trace to end run ice, as well as being able to add a tag for the random Closed Accounts or Market Research.

The 1x addition of Corporate Shuffle just seems like a useful mulligan if your hand clogs up with the wrong thing at the wrong time. All agendas are worth two points, and the Runner will require 4 agendas to win. Although the conventional 'Astrochain' is viable, having two astroscript tokens lets the Corp win with Market Research from hand. It also allows for Hail Mary's with Project Beale. An installed unadvanced Beale can pose as SanSan/Marked Accounts/ Jackson Howard / Red Herrings Caprice Nisei, but can be advanced 5 times with two astroscript tokens.
